title: 107_s1942
content: The "Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002" may be cited as the Act. It provides incentives for biodiesel use as a fuel through a new section in the Internal Revenue Code. The Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002 incentivizes biodiesel use through a biodiesel fuels credit based on the biodiesel mixture credit, which calculates the credit amount for each qualified biodiesel mixture. The Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002 offers a biodiesel mixture credit of 1 cent for each whole percentage point of biodiesel in a qualified biodiesel mixture, not exceeding 20 percentage points. A qualified biodiesel mixture is a blend of diesel and biodiesel sold by the taxpayer producing it for use as fuel. The Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002 provides a 1 cent credit for each percentage point of biodiesel in a qualified mixture, up to 20 percentage points. Biodiesel used in the production of a qualified mixture must be sold or used in the taxpayer's trade or business for the credit to apply. The Biodiesel Promotion Act of 2002 provides a 1 cent credit for each percentage point of biodiesel in a qualified mixture, up to 20 percentage points. The credit does not apply to casual off-farm production of biodiesel mixtures. The credit amount may be reduced to account for any benefit received from other tax exemptions. Definitions and special rules apply for the credit. The term 'biodiesel' is defined as monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids from virgin vegetable oils for use in diesel engines. It includes esters from various vegetable oils like corn, soybeans, and sunflower seeds. The term 'biodiesel' includes esters from various vegetable oils and must meet registration requirements set by the EPA and ASTM D6751 to be considered for tax credits. Tax is imposed on a person who separates biodiesel from a qualified biodiesel mixture or uses the mixture other than as a fuel. Tax is imposed on biodiesel mixtures based on the mixture rate and number of gallons. All applicable laws and penalties apply as if the tax were imposed under a different section. Regulations for estates and trusts follow rules similar to section 52. Tax is imposed on biodiesel mixtures based on the mixture rate and number of gallons. All applicable laws and penalties apply as if the tax were imposed under a different section. Regulations for estates and trusts follow rules similar to section 52. The rules of subsection (d) of section 52 shall apply. A taxpayer may elect to have the biodiesel fuels credit not apply for any taxable year. The election must be made before the expiration of the 3-year period beginning on the last date prescribed by law for filing the return for that taxable year. The manner of making the election shall be in such a way as specified. The biodiesel fuels credit termination date is December 31, 2012. The credit is part of the general business credit under Section 38(b) of the tax code. Conforming amendments are also made. The biodiesel fuels credit termination date is December 31, 2012. Conforming amendments are made to sections 39(d) and 196(c) of the tax code, restricting carryback of the credit before January 1, 2003. The biodiesel fuels credit termination date is December 31, 2012. Amendments are made to various sections of the tax code, including adding a new paragraph (11) for the biodiesel fuels credit under section 40A. Section 6501(m) is amended to include reference to section 40A(e). The table of sections is updated to include the new item related to section 40. The amendments made by this subsection apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2002. Section 4081 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include a new subsection for biodiesel mixtures, with regulations prescribed by the Secretary. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced from the otherwise applicable rate when diesel fuel is used to produce a qualified biodiesel mixture. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate and percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. Definitions in this subsection align with those in section 40A. Certain rules apply to this tax reduction. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate. Rules similar to subsection (c) apply for this tax reduction. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced based on the biodiesel mixture rate, as defined in section 40A(b)(1)(B). If diesel fuel taxed under section 4081 is used to produce a qualified biodiesel mixture sold or used in a trade or business, the Secretary shall apply the tax reduction. The amendments made by this subsection apply to fuel sold after December 31, 2002, and before January 1, 2013. Amounts equivalent to reductions in Highway Trust Fund receipts are transferred from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds to offset the impact. Transfers from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds offset reductions in Highway Trust Fund receipts due to amendments. Secretary of the Treasury makes estimates for transfers, with adjustments for errors in subsequent transfers.
